intro: Limonium bellidifolium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which are adapted to coastal environments. The plant belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its flowers bloom in summer and are often used in garden settings for their ornamental value. Limonium bellidifolium is also valued for its ability to thrive in salty and well-drained conditions.
